text:
“I committed a murder,” he said, his voice trembling. 

Sonia clasped her hands. “To kill? You had the right?” 

“Ach, Sonia!” he cried, irritation flaring. “Don’t interrupt me. I wanted to prove something.” 

“Prove what?” 

“That the devil led me on. I’m just a louse like everyone else.” 

“Then you murdered her!” 

“How? Did I go to kill? I went to try.” 

“Yet, you killed her!” 

“I murdered myself, not her. The devil did it.” 

He buried his head in his hands. 

“What suffering!” Sonia wailed. 

“What am I to do now?” he asked, eyes wild and distorted.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** The protagonist grapples with the moral implications of his actions, feeling that he has not only killed another but has also destroyed himself in the process.
